skill.name: jira-cli
skill.description: Interact with Jira from the command line to create, list, view, edit, and transition issues, manage sprints and epics, and perform common Jira workflows. Use when the user asks about Jira tasks, tickets, issues, sprints, or needs to manage project work items.
skill.summary: Interact with Jira from the command line to create, list, view, edit, and transition issues, manage ...
skill.author: Code-and-Sorts

security_audit.summary: This is a documentation-only skill that provides instructions for using the jira-cli tool. It contains no executable code, network calls, or file system access beyond documentation.

content.user_title: Manage Jira Issues with Command Line
content.value_statement: Stop switching between browser tabs to manage Jira tasks. This skill provides complete command-line documentation for creating, editing, and tracking issues.
actual_capabilities: Provides documentation for jira-cli tool usage
Covers issue creation, editing, and management
Includes sprint and epic management commands
Explains output formats and scripting options
limitations: Requires separate installation of jira-cli tool
Requires initial configuration with jira init
Some features vary between Jira Cloud and Server

use_cases.title: Quick issue management
use_cases.description: Create and update Jira issues without leaving your terminal or IDE

use_cases.title: Sprint planning automation
use_cases.description: Bulk manage issues, assign tasks, and track sprint progress efficiently

use_cases.title: CI/CD integration
use_cases.description: Automate Jira updates from deployment pipelines and scripts

prompt_templates.title: Create a bug report
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a high priority bug in Jira with title 'Login fails on mobile' and description 'Users cannot authenticate on iOS devices'

prompt_templates.title: List my tasks
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me all my assigned Jira issues that are in progress or to do

prompt_templates.title: Complete an issue
prompt_templates.prompt: Move issue PROJ-123 to Done status and log 2 hours of work with comment 'Fixed authentication bug'

prompt_templates.title: Sprint planning
prompt_templates.prompt: List all issues in the current sprint and show their status in a table format

output_examples.input: List my high priority issues in plain text
output: PROJ-105 Security vulnerability in auth module

best_practices: Set up jira init configuration before first use to avoid repeated prompts
Use --plain flag for scripting and automation to get predictable output
Store JIRA_API_TOKEN in your shell profile for persistent authentication
anti_patterns: Do not share your JIRA_API_TOKEN or commit it to version control
Avoid using interactive mode in automated scripts - use explicit flags
Do not rely on default project settings - always specify project explicitly

faq.question: Is this skill compatible with all Jira instances?
faq.answer: Works with Jira Cloud and most Jira Server instances. Some features may vary between versions.

faq.question: What are the rate limits?
faq.answer: Rate limits depend on your Jira instance configuration. Check with your Jira administrator.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with my CI/CD pipeline?
faq.answer: Yes, use --plain or --raw flags for script-friendly output that integrates with automation tools.

faq.question: Is my Jira data safe?
faq.answer: This skill only provides documentation. The actual jira-cli tool uses HTTPS and your API token for secure authentication.

faq.question: I'm getting 'command not found' error
faq.answer: Install jira-cli first: brew install ankitpokhrel/jira-cli/jira-cli or download from GitHub releases.

faq.question: How does this compare to the web interface?
faq.answer: Command line is faster for bulk operations and automation, while web interface offers richer visual features.
